intro: Paratrophis solomonensis, commonly known as the Solomon Islands spider lily, is a flowering plant native to the Solomon Islands. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant produces a tall, slender stem with narrow, strap-like leaves. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
